Removes every instance of the targeted
from the drops, until the maximum amount of removals is reached.

content.content: For example, assume the loot drops 2 carrots, 3 potatoes, and 1 iron ingot and that this loot modifier has been asked to remove 4 edible items. The result of applying the loot modifier will be to remove the 2 carrots and 2 out of the 3 potatoes, resulting in a final drop list of 1 iron ingot and 1 potato.

children.content: s to remove along with their quantity.
Replaces every instance of the targeted

As an example, if the loot drops 5 carrots and this loot modifier runs with 2 carrots as the key of a pair and 1 potato as the corresponding value, the loot will be modified to 2 potatoes and 1 carrot. This happens because every 2-carrot stack will be actively replaced by a 1-potato stack, without exceptions.
This loot modifier acts differently than
, where a simpler approach is used.
A map of key-value pairs dictating the target to replace along with their replacement.
